thread.title: Sepp Blatter reign at FIFA will now extend to Feb. 26
thread.title_full: Sepp Blatter reign at FIFA will now extend to Feb. 26 - MarketWatch

author: By     Joshua Robinson   and   John Revill
title: Sepp Blatter reign at FIFA will now extend to Feb. 26
text:
AFP/Getty Images Sepp Blatter speaks at a March 2014 press conference. ZURICH — Soccer’s world governing body said Monday that it will hold an extraordinary presidential election on Feb. 26 to decide who will replace embattled President Sepp Blatter.
Blatter, 79, said in June that he would step down from the position he has held since 1998 in the wake of a corruption scandal which has rocked Zurich-based FIFA in recent months. He, would, he said, make “his mandate available.”
Don’t miss: The Sepp Blatter name is also poison at the box office
And: FIFA sponsors welcome news of Sepp Blatter’s resignation
The Zurich-based organization will hold a special meeting on Feb. 26 at which its 209 members will elect a new top executive. The date is more than two months later than initially expected, meaning that Blatter’s tenure will have continued nearly nine months past the time he announced his resignation. Would-be candidates now have until Oct. 26 to throw their hats in the ring.
FIFA to Hold Extraordinary Presidential Election (1:33) FIFA President Sepp Blatter’s first news conference since stepping down as president was interrupted by a demonstrator on Monday. Photo: AP
An expanded version of this report appears at WSJ.com.
